alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 26 at 11:35PM EDT until June 27 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HUNTERDON...MERCER...NORTH CENTRAL BURLINGTON... SOUTHWESTERN SOMERSET...SOUTHWESTERN MONMOUTH...SOUTHWESTERN MIDDLESEX AND EAST CENTRAL BUCKS COUNTIES... At 1135 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Flagtown to Rocky Hill to near Crosswicks to Browns Mills, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Ewing, Princeton, Hightstown, Flemington, Bordentown, Cranbury, Pennington, Yardley, Hopewell, Tullytown, Allentown, Roosevelt, Wrightstown, Rocky Hill, Skillman, Flagtown, Georgetown, Clarksburg and White Horse. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 7 and 8A. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 26 and 27. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 17. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 53 and 76. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
